“The issue is making sure children who really need treatment get it”—Britain’s landmark trans ruling

BRITAIN’S HIGH COURT has ruled that puberty blockers for children with gender dysphoria have been dispensed too readily, fuelling a debate that will be keenly watched abroad. A vote today on a law tightening accounting rules on American-listed Chinese companies has a political dimension—and implications for investors.
